citation: Proclamation under the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council and with the approval of Each House of Parliament, by this my proclamation made under sections 14(1) and 16(1) of the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 â€“

        (a) declare that the area of land given the name Central Plateau Conservation Area and specified in section 17 of, and Part 1 of Schedule 9 to, the Regional Forest Agreement (Land Classification) Act 1998 ceases to be reserved land; and
        (b) revoke the proclamation notified in the Gazette as Statutory Rules 1990, No. 79; and
        (c) amend the proclamation notified in the Gazette as Statutory Rules 2000, No. 241 by omitting from Schedule 1 to that proclamation the item relating to the Central Plateau Conservation Area comprising an approximate area of 2 730 hectares and shown on Plan Number 5006 in the Central Plan Register; and
        (d) declare the Crown land specified in Part 1 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be reserved land in the class of conservation area and give the name Central Plateau Conservation Area to that reserved land; and
        (e) declare the Crown land specified in Part 2 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be reserved land in the class of conservation area and give the name Five Mile Pinnacles Conservation Area to that reserved land; and
        (f) declare the Crown land specified in Part 3 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be reserved land in the class of conservation area and give the name Great Lake Conservation Area to that reserved land; and
        (g) declare the Crown land specified in Part 4 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be reserved land in the class of conservation area and give the name Jones Rivulet Conservation Area to that reserved land; and
        (h) declare the Crown land specified in Part 5 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be reserved land in the class of conservation area and give the name Liawenee Conservation Area to that reserved land; and
        (i) declare the Crown land specified in Part 6 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be reserved land in the class of conservation area and give the name Morass Bay Conservation Area to that reserved land; and
        (j) declare the Crown land specified in Part 7 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be reserved land in the class of conservation area and give the name Rainbow Point Conservation Area to that reserved land; and
        (k) declare the Crown land specified in Part 8 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be reserved land in the class of conservation area and give the name Rocky Point Conservation Area to that reserved land; and
        (l) declare the Crown land specified in Part 9 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be reserved land in the class of conservation area and give the name Tea-Tree Bay Conservation Area to that reserved land; and
        (m) declare the Crown land specified in Part 10 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be reserved land in the class of conservation area and give the name Top Marshes Conservation Area to that reserved land; and
        (n) declare that this proclamation takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.
17 December 2001

G. S. M. GREEN

Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

D. E. LLEWELLYN

Minister for Primary Industries, Water and Environment

SCHEDULE 1 - Areas of land

PART 1 - Central Plateau Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 90 870 hectares shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan Number 5722 in the Central Plan Register a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 1 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

PART 2 - Five Mile Pinnacles Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 483.7 hectares shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan Number 5730 in the Central Plan Register a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 2 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

PART 3 - Great Lake Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 8 631 hectares shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan Number 5729 in the Central Plan Register a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 3 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

PART 4 - Jones Rivulet Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 64.3 hectares shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan Number 5723 in the Central Plan Register a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 4 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

PART 5 - Liawenee Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 62.26 hectares shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan Number 5728 in the Central Plan Register a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 5 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

PART 6 - Morass Bay Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 131.2 hectares shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan Number 5725 in the Central Plan Register a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 6 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

PART 7 - Rainbow Point Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 22.5 hectares shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan Number 5724 in the Central Plan Register a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 7 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

PART 8 - Rocky Point Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 51.2 hectares shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan Number 5727 in the Central Plan Register a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 8 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

PART 9 - Tea-Tree Bay Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 28.8 hectares shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan Number 5726 in the Central Plan Register a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 9 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

PART 10 - Top Marshes Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 2 730 hectares shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan Number 5006 in the Central Plan Register a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 10 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

SCHEDULE 2 - Plans

PART 1 - Central Plateau Conservation Area

PART 2 - Five Mile Pinnacles Conservation Area

PART 3 - Great Lake Conservation Area

PART 4 - Jones Rivulet Conservation Area

PART 5 - Liawenee Conservation Area

PART 6 - Morass Bay Conservation Area

PART 7 - Rainbow Point Conservation Area

PART 8 - Rocky Point Conservation Area

PART 9 - Tea-Tree Bay Conservation Area

PART 10 - Top Marshes Conservation Area

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 26 December 2001

This proclamation is administered in the Department of Primary Industries, Water and Environment.
